availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Dimmitt (Hopkins County, Ky, minister and captain 10th ky mtd inf (csa))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, minister and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Frances Dimmitt. Father of Robert D. Dimmitt, Bushard Dimmitt, M. S. Dimmitt, M. F. Dimmitt, and Sallie G. Dimmitt. Schoolteacher in Hopkins County in 1850. Minister in Madisonville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Madisonville in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a captain and chaplain

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 158B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 840.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 221B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 252.
"William Currens Dimmitt (1825-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial #103578648, accessed January 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103578648.
